parameter.name: helm_version
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the helm version which should be used.\n This parameter can be overridden by the playlist variable HELM_VERSION which has higher priority and if neither is specified then the default value 3 (helm version three) is used.

parameter.name: crd_namespace
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name space to encompass the Kubernetes resources comprising the CRDs.\n This parameter can be overridden by the playlist variable CRD_NAMESPACE which has higher priority, but at least one must be specified.

parameter.name: sc_namespace
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name space to encompass the Kubernetes resources comprising the SC application.\n This parameter can be overridden by the playlist variable SC_NAMESPACE which has higher priority, but at least one must be specified.

parameter.name: crd_release_name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the CRD release name required for the CRDS.\n This parameter can be overridden by the playlist variable CRD_RELEASE_NAME which has higher priority, but at least one must be specified.

parameter.name: sc_release_name
parameter.description:
This parameter specifies the Deployment release name required for the SC application.
 This parameter can be overridden by the playlist variable SC_RELEASE_NAME which has higher priority, but at least one must be specified.
 Starting with release SC 1.15, the name specified here will no longer be used as a release name in the helm printouts which instead will have the following names depending on the deployed CNF:
 - eric-cloud-native-base (always present) - eric-cloud-native-nf-additions (always present) - eric-sc-bsf (only present if BSF is deployed) - eric-sc-dsc (only present if DSC is deployed) - eric-sc-cs (always present) - eric-sc-scp (only present if SCP is deployed) - eric-sc-sepp (only present if SCP is deployed) So the name specified here is just used for backwards compatibility with SC 1.14 and earlier but should always be specified since some playlists expects it to be present.

parameter.name: node_vip_address
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the VIP address to be used for connecting to the cluster where the SC/DSC will be deployed.\n This is normally the VIP address to reach one of the control or master nodes, but not the direct address for the individual control or master nodes.

parameter.name: node_worker_address
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the IP address to be used for certain actions on the cluster.\n This is normally the IP address of a node with the labels 'ci/ip' or 'ci/ip6' as seen with 'kubectl describe nodes' or one of the worker nodes internal IP-addresses as seen with 'kubectl get nodes -o wide'.

parameter.name: eric_sc_values_anchor_parameter_private_registry_secret_name
parameter.description: Global image registry pull secret (old releases)

parameter.name: eric_sc_values_hash_parameter_global.pullSecret
parameter.description: Global image registry pull secret

parameter.name: private_crd_registry_secret
parameter.description: Global image registry pull secret for CRDs (if different than registry for SC Docker images)

parameter.name: eric_sc_values_anchor_parameter_private_registry_url
parameter.description: URL for the Registry hosting the SC Application Docker images (old releases)

parameter.name: eric_sc_values_hash_parameter_global.registry.url
parameter.description: URL for the Registry hosting the SC Application Docker images

parameter.name: private_crd_registry_url
parameter.description: URL for the Registry hosting the CRD Docker images (if different than registry for SC Docker images)

parameter.name: day0_admin_secret_hash_parameter_metadata.name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the secret used for the day 0 admin user and it will be used to update the day0adminsecret_Template.yaml file.

parameter.name: day0_admin_secret_hash_parameter_data.adminuser
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user name of the secret used for the day 0 admin user and it will be used to update the day0adminsecret_Template.yaml file.\n The value should be the base64 encoded version of the real user name, i.e. it should not be in clear text.

parameter.name: day0_admin_secret_hash_parameter_data.adminpasswd
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user password of the secret used for the day 0 admin user and it will be used to update the day0adminsecret_Template.yaml file.\n The value should be the base64 encoded version of the real user password, i.e. it should not be in clear text.

parameter.name: dsc_wcdb_secret_hash_parameter_metadata.name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the secret used for the dsc wcdb user and it will be used to update the dsc-wcdb-secret_Template.yaml file.

parameter.name: dsc_wcdb_secret_hash_parameter_data.dsc_user
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user name of the secret used for the dsc wcdb user and it will be used to update the dsc-wcdb-secret_Template.yaml file.\n The value should be the base64 encoded version of the real user name, i.e. it should not be in clear text.

parameter.name: dsc_wcdb_secret_hash_parameter_data.dsc_user_password
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user password of the secret used for the dsc wcdb user and it will be used to update the dsc-wcdb-secret_Template.yaml file.\n The value should be the base64 encoded version of the real user password, i.e. it should not be in clear text.

parameter.name: eric_sc_values_hash_parameter_eric-bsf.service.worker.allocateLoadBalancerNodePorts
parameter.description: Enabling nodeports

parameter.name: eric_sc_values_hash_parameter_eric-bsf.service.worker.annotations.loadBalancerIPs
parameter.description: Overwriting loadBalancerIPs in Upgrades

parameter.name: eric_sc_values_hash_parameter_eric-bsf.service.worker.ipFamilyPolicy
parameter.description: Setting ipFamilyPolicy

parameter.name: eric_sc_values_hash_parameter_eric-bsf-diameter.enabled
parameter.description: This parameter specifies if a CNF should be enabled (true) or not (false) when deploying or upgrading the software.\n The parameter can also be overridden by the playlist variable ENABLED_CNF which has higher priority or by specifying an already filled in 'eric-sc-values.yaml' file by using playlist variable CONFIG_FILE_HELM_CHART, which in such case have the highest priority.\n In both cases can this parameter be left unchanged.

parameter.name: eric_sc_values_hash_parameter_eric-data-object-storage-mn.enabled
parameter.description: needed for objectStorage

parameter.name: eric_sc_values_hash_parameter_eric-data-sftp-server.enabled
parameter.description: This parameter specifies if a CNF should be enabled (true) or not (false) when deploying or upgrading the software.\n The parameter can also be overridden by the playlist variable ENABLED_CNF which has higher priority or by specifying an already filled in 'eric-sc-values.yaml' file by using playlist variable CONFIG_FILE_HELM_CHART, which in such case have the highest priority.\n In both cases can this parameter be left unchanged.

parameter.name: eric_sc_values_hash_parameter_eric-data-wide-column-database-cd.enabled
parameter.description: This parameter will enable the wcdb

parameter.name: eric_sc_values_hash_parameter_eric-log-shipper.logshipper.harvester.closeTimeout
parameter.description: This parameter is temporarliy set to prevent OOMkilled termination in this cluster.\n

parameter.name: eric_sc_values_hash_parameter_eric-pm-bulk-reporter.objectStorage.enabled
parameter.description: needed for objectStorage

parameter.name: eric_sc_values_hash_parameter_eric-probe-virtual-tap-broker.egress.VirtualTapBroker.dscp
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the DSCP value for VTAP packets. The system's default value is 16. \n Value 20 is chosen not due to a specific reason, but only to have a different one than 16

parameter.name: eric_sc_values_hash_parameter_eric-probe-virtual-tap-broker.enabled
parameter.description: This parameter specifies if a CNF should be enabled (true) or not (false) when deploying or upgrading the software.\n The parameter can also be overridden by the playlist variable ENABLED_CNF which has higher priority or by specifying an already filled in 'eric-sc-values.yaml' file by using playlist variable CONFIG_FILE_HELM_CHART, which in such case have the highest priority.\n In both cases can this parameter be left unchanged.

parameter.name: eccd_capo_lcm_host_address
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the host address for the Life Cycle Management (LCM) server where installation of ECCD on the node will be executed from.

parameter.name: eccd_capo_lcm_password
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user password for the Life Cycle Management (LCM) server where installation of ECCD on the node will be executed from.

parameter.name: eccd_capo_lcm_user
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user name for the Life Cycle Management (LCM) server where installation of ECCD on the node will be executed from.

parameter.name: eccd_openstack_host_address
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the host address for the OpenStack server where installation of ECCD on the node will be executed from.

parameter.name: eccd_openstack_password
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user password for the OpenStack server where installation of ECCD on the node will be executed from.

parameter.name: eccd_openstack_user
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user name for the OpenStack server where installation of ECCD on the node will be executed from.

parameter.name: evnfm_clustername
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the cluster to be used in CURL commands towards EVNFM and is used in special EVNFM playlists.\n The parameter can also be overridden by the playlist variable CLUSTERNAME which has higher priority.\n If the special EVNFM playlists are not being used then this parameter can be left unchanged.

parameter.name: evnfm_ingress_host_address
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Ingress host address to be used in CURL commands towards EVNFM and is used in special EVNFM playlists.\n The parameter can also be overridden by the playlist variable INGRESS_HOST_ADDRESS which has higher priority.\n If the special EVNFM playlists are not being used then this parameter can be left unchanged.

parameter.name: evnfm_password
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the password to be used when creating a special EVNFM session token to be used in CURL commands towards EVNFM and is used in special EVNFM playlists.\n The parameter can also be overridden by the playlist variable PASSWORD which has higher priority.\n If the special EVNFM playlists are not being used then this parameter can be left unchanged.

parameter.name: evnfm_username
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the password to be used when creating a special EVNFM session token to be used in CURL commands towards EVNFM and is used in special EVNFM playlists.\n The parameter can also be overridden by the playlist variable USERNAME which has higher priority.\n If the special EVNFM playlists are not being used then this parameter can be left unchanged.

parameter.name: tools_namespace
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name space to encompass the Kubernetes resources comprising the tools application.\n This parameter can be overridden by the playlist variable TOOLS_NAMESPACE which has higher priority, but at least one must be specified.

parameter.name: tools_node_vip_address
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the VIP address to be used for connecting to the cluster where the tools will be deployed.\n This is normally the VIP address to reach one of the control or master nodes, but not the direct address for the individual control or master nodes.

parameter.name: tools_node_worker_address
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the IP address to be used for certain actions on the cluster where the tools are deployed.\n This is normally the IP address of a node with the labels 'ci/ip' or 'ci/ip6' as seen with 'kubectl describe nodes' or one of the worker nodes internal IP-addresses as seen with 'kubectl get nodes -o wide'.

parameter.description: Storage class name used for the persistent volume claim
